articles.author: Kirti Pandey
articles.title: One cup of leafy green vegetables a day lowers risk of heart disease: Study - Times Now
articles.description: Good health does not have to cost a fortune. An Oz university study has found that by eating just one cup of nitrate-rich green-leafy vegetables each day people can significantly reduce heart disease risk.
articles.content:
• We all know greens are good for us and we must eat leafy vegetables often.
  • Now an Australian study nails the optimum intake one needs to ensure daily for a healthy heart.
